pr_title: mgmt-core, support systemData for Azure resource

timeline.bodyText: Class name derived from specs, though we should be able to change to a better name if applicable.
timeline.author: weidongxu-microsoft
weidongxu-microsoft

replies.bodyText: Also appreciate suggestion on method names in SystemData. They seems a bit off (but I do not have better idea).
replies.author: weidongxu-microsoft

replies.bodyText: IdentityType sounds like a better name than CreatedByType as it is used for lastModifiedByType too.
replies.author: srnagar

replies.bodyText: SystemData seems very generic. Is this name finalized? Can we change this to AzureResourceSystemData?
replies.author: srnagar

replies.bodyText: The method names look fine but just want to check, do we prefix get for getter methods in other arm model types?
replies.author: srnagar

replies.bodyText:
Got it. Another candidate could be ResourceAuthorIdentityType.
It is generic. The class is intended to be returned by every ARM resources (resource group, virtual network, disk, storage account, virtual machine, etc., well, all) in future. It is already in com.azure.core.management namespace. On the other hand from its name, it does seems belong to something of operating system (so far, I didn't find any existing SystemData class that going to be confused with this). Maybe ResourceSystemData would be better. Let me check e.g. how python or .NET names it.
It is still used as POJO for ARM, so like Resource class, it does not have get prefix.
replies.author: weidongxu-microsoft

timeline.bodyText: Is this type missing a constructor? How are the property values set?
timeline.author: srnagar

replies.bodyText: The class is initialized by Jackson (via reflection), hence no constructor (or just default constructor). All properties is read-only, hence no setter.
replies.author: weidongxu-microsoft
